RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute

RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute Class Reference

#include <objectattribute.h>

Inheritance diagram for RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

The super-class of all object attribute.

An Attribute is a pair Name/Value. It has a description field for the console show object command and an access control (the attribute can be read-only).

There are several attribute type : IntAttribute, CharAttribute, BoolAttribute.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::ObjectAttribute ( const char *  name  )  [protected]

The constructor of a named object attribute.

the setName( char* name) method is used internally.

Parameters:

Member Function Documentation

int RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::count (  )  [virtual]

Count the available commands for this attribute.

Returns:
1 if the attribute is in read-only mode, otherwise returns 2.

const char * RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::getAccessText (  ) 

Get the access mode in text format.

Returns:
[ro] if the attribute is in read-only mode, otherwise return [rw] (read and write mode).

const char * RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::getDesc (  ) 

Get the description of the attribute.

If the desc string is empty, a warning message will be send to the Logger.

Returns:
A char* to the description of the attribute

const char * RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::getName (  ) 

Get the name of the attribute.

Returns:
The value of the name property

virtual const char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::getTypeText (  )  [pure virtual]

Return a char * defining the type of the attribute.

This function is used by the console to show the type of the attribute. It must be [int] [char] [bool]...

Implemented in RainbruRPG::Exception::BoolAttribute, and RainbruRPG::Exception::IntAttribute.

virtual const char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::getValueText (  )  [pure virtual]

Return a char * of the value.

This function is used by the console to get the value. According to the type of the child the implementation will be different.

Implemented in RainbruRPG::Exception::BoolAttribute, RainbruRPG::Exception::FpsAttribute, RainbruRPG::Exception::GuiTransAttribute, and RainbruRPG::Exception::IntAttribute.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::setDesc ( const char *  desc  ) 

Change the DescriptionÂ of the attribute.

Send a warning message to the Logger if the parameter is an empty string.

Parameters:
desc The new description string

void RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::setName ( const char *  name  ) 

Change the name of this attribute.

The char* is set to the name attribute. If it is NULL (an empty string) an Error message is send to the Logger.

Parameters:
name The new name of the attribute

virtual bool RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::setValueText ( const char *   )  [pure virtual]

Set the value of the attribute.

This function is used by the console to set the value. According to the type of the child the implementation will be different. The function must return if the set is correct.

Returns:
true if the affectation is correct otherwise false.

Implemented in RainbruRPG::Exception::BoolAttribute, and RainbruRPG::Exception::IntAttribute.

Member Data Documentation

const char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::desc [private]

The description of the attribute.

The description will be shown with the name with the show command

const char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::name [private]

The name of the attribute.

This name can't be null. It's the name we use in the console to access its attributes.

bool RainbruRPG::Exception::ObjectAttribute::readOnly [protected]

Is this attribute in read only mode.

Some attributes can't be modified.
